00021 namespace bits

00023 
00024   // template metaprogramming :)
00025   // To compute at compilation time a power
00026   template <int X, unsigned exponent> class POW
00027   {
00028   public:       enum{ VALUE = X* POW<X, exponent-1>::VALUE};
00029   };
00030   template <int X > class POW<X, 1>
00031   {
00032   public:       enum{ VALUE = X };
00033   };
00034 
00035 
00036 #define mymax(a,b) ( ((a)<(b))?(b):(a) )
00037 #define mymin(a,b) ( ((a)<(b))?(a):(b) )
00038 
00039 
00040   // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00041   // Debug tools
00042   // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00050   template <typename T>
00051   std::string bitString(T value, unsigned nbBits = 0)
00052   {
00053     std::string bitStr;
00054     // if the requested number of bit is 0, use the size of the data type instead
00055     if(nbBits == 0) nbBits = sizeof(T)*8;
00056     int i = mymin(sizeof(T)*8-1, nbBits-1);
00057     //cerr << "bitString: i = " << i << endl;
00058     for(; i>=0; i--)
00059       {
00060         T mask = ((T)1) << i; // if you take these parenthesis out, a mountain of incredible runtime errors will jump on you.(I warned ya !)
00061         if(value & mask)
00062           bitStr += "1" ;
00063         else
00064           bitStr += "0" ;
00065       }
00066     return bitStr;
00067   }
00068 
00069 
00070   // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00071   //    Other functions
00072   // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00073 
00077   template<typename T> 
00078   inline T mask(unsigned nthBit)
00079   {
00080     return static_cast<T>(static_cast<T>(1) << nthBit); // you are never too careful these days...
00081   }
00082 
00086   template <typename T>
00087   inline bool getBit(T key, unsigned nthBit)
00088   {
00089     return ( key & mask<T>(nthBit) );
00090   }
00091 
00092   
00097   template <typename T>
00098   T firstSetBit(T val)
00099   {
00100     return (val & -val | val & (~val + 1));
00101   }
00102 
00103 
00108   template <typename T>
00109   T firstUnsetBit(T val)
00110   {
00111     return ~val & (val + 1);
00112   }
00113 
00114 
00118   template <typename T>
00119   unsigned nbSetBits(T val)
00120   {
00121     unsigned i = 0;
00122     for ( ; val; ++i) {val ^= val & -val; }
00123     return i;
00124   }
